etymology.description: semantic: 穴 ‘cave, hole’ + phonetic: 工
etymology.interpretation: 穴 signals the idea of a hollow or cavity, pointing to emptiness or open space, while 工 supplies a similar sound. The combination evokes a hollow void, which naturally extended to the vast open expanse above, hence the sense ‘sky’.

examples.chinese: 这个箱子是空的(這個箱子是空的)。
房间里还空着两张床(房間裡還空著兩張床)。
examples.pinyin: Fángjiān lǐ hái kōngzhe liǎng zhāng chuáng.
examples.english: There are still two empty beds in the room.
